metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7117 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the __sys_recvmmsg function in net/socket.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors involving a recvmmsg system call that is mishandled during error processing. Dmitry Vyukov discovered a use-after-free vulnerability during error processing in the recvmmsg(2) implementation in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
